p: Campylobacter spp. are gram-negative, mobile, and non-spore-forming bacteria. They colonize the gastrointestinal tract of various host species as commensals such as birds and ruminants, including cattle, sheep, and goats [ 5, 6]. The bacteria can also cause diarrhea in these animals [ 7]. Nevertheless, bacteria from this genus are the cause of miscarriages and infertility in ruminants [ 8].
